title: China's crackdown on Hong Kong fuels fears in Taiwan
description: As China cracked down on the pro-democracy movement in Hong Kong, the Taiwanese public watched on anxiously. Some fear they could be next to see harsher clampdowns as China steps up pressure on the democratic island of 24 million to "unify" with the mainland. CNN's Will Ripley reports.

title: 'South Park: Post Covid' imagines a future after the pandemic
description: Kyle, Stan, Kenny, and Cartman navigate life after the pandemic in "South Park: Post Covid," streaming now on Paramount+.

title: In pictures: Americans celebrate Thanksgiving
description: This is the second Thanksgiving holiday of the Covid-19 pandemic, but it's the first since vaccines have become available to the public.

title: Malawi defends decision to ask Mike Tyson to be its cannabis ambassador
description: The government of Malawi has defended its decision to invite the former heavyweight champion boxer Mike Tyson to become the country's official cannabis ambassador following a backlash over his conviction for rape in the 1990s.

title: Fauci gives his take on new Covid variant
description: Dr. Anthony Fauci discusses the discovery of the new B.1.1.529 Covid-19 variant that appears to be spreading rapidly in parts of South Africa and what it may mean for the efficacy of the coronavirus vaccines.

title: The pilot who helped 1,000 Afghan refugees flee to America
description: Zak Khogyani has seen sights and wonders that would fill you with awe.

title: Police launch murder inquiry after 12-year-old girl is killed in Liverpool city center assault
description: Police in Liverpool, northwest England, have launched a murder inquiry after a 12-year-old girl was killed in an assault in the city center Thursday evening.

title: Even in a polarized country, Britain's Home Secretary is uniquely divisive
World leader claims Russia is plotting coup against him
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Friday that a group of Ukrainians and Russians are planning a coup against him at the beginning of December. CNN's Matthew Chance reports.

title: Amazon workers go on strike as four-day shopping bonanza kicks off
Four years later, imprisoned oil executives remain pawns in a US-Venezuela standoff
description: The phone connection between a Venezuelan prison cell and Houston, Texas, crackles and fades.

title: What happened to Jimmy Hoffa's body? The FBI may have new intel
description: CNN's Miguel Marquez reports on the mysterious case of Jimmy Hoffa as the FBI conducted another search for the remains of the one-time Teamsters boss who was last seen alive in 1975.

title: Prince William's overpopulation remarks will do women no favors
description: When it comes to overpopulation as the cause of wildlife loss in Africa, Prince William just won't let it go.

title: What happens to Black Friday in a pandemic?
description: What happens to Black Friday in the midst of a pandemic? CNN Business explains why the shopping event has changed.

title: Egypt reopens 3,400-year-old Avenue of the Sphinxes
description: A restored road connecting two ancient Egyptian temple complexes in Karnak and Luxor was unveiled on Thursday in a lavish ceremony aimed at raising the profile of one of Egypt's top tourist spots.

title: World Athletics finds female athletes target of 87 percent of online abuse at Tokyo Olympics
description: World Athletics has found that female athletes were the target of 87 percent of all online abuse at this year's Tokyo Olympics.

title: World Athletics finds female athletes target of 87 percent of online abuse at Tokyo Olympics
description: World Athletics has found that female athletes were the target of 87 percent of all online abuse at this year's Tokyo Olympics. The findings come from a study conducted during the Games and published on Thursday.

title: Why France's wine 'disaster' could have delicious consequences
description: France's Burgundy winemakers agree on one thing: 2021 was about as catastrophic a year as any of them can remember.

title: The super-rich want sundecks on their private aircraft
description: A helicopter with vegan seats, a private jet with a sundeck and garage, and a hotelier's plan to hold discos at 35,000 feet -- all three concepts were unveiled at the Dubai Airshow last week among a host of others designed to lure VIP travelers back to the sky.

title: Madonna hits out at Instagram for removing photos
description: Madonna has hit out at Instagram for removing photos from her page because part of her nipple was showing.

title: Politician representing Calais has harsh words for Boris Johnson in interview
description: Pierre-Henri Dumont, Member of the French National Assembly representing the port city of Calais, France, speaks with CNN's Bianca Nobilo about the death of 27 people who were trying to cross the English Channel.

title: Solomon Islands tells public workers to stay home as violent protests continue for third day
description: The Solomon Islands government has advised all public servants to stay at home as violent protests continued for a third day on Friday, with crowds gathering at the Prime Minister's residence.

title: Trump pulls strings behind the scenes to help loyal 2022 candidates
description: Former President Donald Trump has taken his involvement in 2022 Republican primaries to a new level as he works to permanently mold the GOP in his image. Beyond Trump's public efforts to oust Republican incumbents he considers disloyal, he has quietly tried to clear potential GOP threats to his endorsed candidates and encouraged others to run against his enemies.

title: Artist's joke to his friends garners $600k
description: After jokingly asking his friends for money on his birthday, Nigerian-American artist Davido says he raised more than $600,000 for Nigerian orphanages.

title: 'Job done': Belgium hammers Armenia 19-0 in Women's World Cup qualifying to set team record
description: Belgium obliterated Armenia 19-0 on Thursday night in their Women's World Cup qualifying clash.

title: Indian farmers forced Modi to back down on new laws. So why aren't they going home?
description: Santosh Singh's earliest memory is of tilling soil on his family's farm. Now, the 70-year-old farmer's eyes gleam with pride as he recalls watching his grandson do the same.

title: After 'sexting' scandal, this man is tasked with healing Australian cricket
description: Fast bowler Pat Cummins was confirmed as Australia's 47th test captain on Friday, tasked with galvanising the team at short order before the Ashes amid the fall-out from Tim Paine's resignation and decision to take a break from cricket.

title: Stocks and oil plunge as new Covid variant fears slam markets
description: Dow futures plunged and oil fell 5% on Friday as the emergence of a new Covid-19 variant rattled global markets.

title: Britain's hardline home secretary exposes the fault lines of a divided country
description: Priti Patel, Britain's hardline home secretary, is under renewed scrutiny following the deaths of dozens of people in the English Channel -- one of the worst tragedies affecting migrants bound for Britain in recent memory.

title: A British guy crashed her Thanksgiving dinner. They've been married for 20 years
description: It was November 1997 and Dina Honour was hosting Thanksgiving dinner for the first time. The then 27-year-old invited a group of New York City friends who, like her, had decided to stay in the city over the holidays.

title: Dallas Cowboys suffer heartbreaking overtime loss to the Las Vegas Raiders on Thanksgiving
description: Daniel Carlson kicked a 29-yard field goal in overtime to condemn the Dallas Cowboys to a heartbreaking home 36-33 loss to the Las Vegas Raiders on Thanksgiving.

title: The UK has banned flights from 6 African countries as the new variant spreads rapidly in South Africa
IOC member Dick Pound 'puzzled' by reaction to Peng Shuai video call
Pioneer of German football to take over as interim manager at Manchester United
description: Ralf Rangnick is set to be been named as Manchester United's interim manager, the Athletic and other media outlets reported on Thursday.

title: The US is a global outlier on guns. Here's how it compares to the rest of the world.
SoftBank hit by report that China may force Didi to quit Wall Street
description: Shares of SoftBank plunged about 5% in Tokyo on Friday after Chinese regulators reportedly asked Didi to delist from the United States because of concerns about data security.

title: Amber captures rare plant behavior in an ancient, extinct pine cone
description: The first fossil evidence of a pine cone sprouting seeds has been preserved in 40 million-year-old amber.

title: Why you might be happier if you don't buy anything on Black Friday
description: I delight in finding the perfect gift for a loved one and experience joy in thoughtful personal purchases. But I bristle against spending for the sake of spending, especially for manufactured "holidays" like Black Friday.

title: Thousands without power in Southern California as fierce winds fuel potential wildfire threat for 17 million people
description: More than 70,000 homes and businesses in Southern California lost power on Thanksgiving as the region battles dangerously dry conditions and high winds, with gusts topping 70 mph in some areas.

title: French fishermen threaten to block Channel Tunnel, ports in protest over fishing licenses
description:
• Britain and France escalate war of words after Channel tragedy
• Video: Reporter in Calais shows boat provided by smugglers

title: Pigs go hog wild on golf course, injure two and force club closure
description: The festive season is typically time for pigs in blankets, but at one British golf club, some oinkers have been creating quite a stir.

title: 'Don't fight it, play it': MMA fighter on the addictive nature of jiu-jitsu
description: Even as a three-year-old, Tom DeBlass noticed that his father sometimes looked different when he returned home.

title: Murder suspect from Taiwan 'trapped' in hotel quarantine
description: China's stringent zero-Covid policy has allowed authorities to catch thousands of imported coronavirus cases. But, occasionally, it might help catch a fugitive too.

title: History in the making: Photographer of the Year winners revealed
description: "The past is never dead," Nobel Prize winning novelist William Faulkner once wrote. "It's not even past."

title: Vibrant skin patterns and colored feathers: Stunning paleoart shows what dinosaurs really looked like
description: Crystal Palace Park, in south London, still hosts the world's first dinosaur sculptures. They were created in the 1850s based on what were, at the time, very recent scientific discoveries: fossils, unearthed in England just decades earlier.

title: US lawmakers meet with Taiwan officials despite China's 'blunt' demand to call trip off
description: Five US lawmakers arrived in Taiwan on Thursday to meet with government officials, defying Beijing to visit the contested island.
